snippet: A study has found that the protocol of meting out meals with caution to people hospitalized with anorexia does not work.
abstract: Some researchers and health providers are starting to question standard practice for feeding teenaged anorexic hospital patients, which involves starting with very small amounts of food and working up to incrementally larger meals; study published in The Journal of Adolescent Health found majority of anorexic patients suffered further weight loss during early part of regiment.
lead_paragraph: A study has found that the protocol of meting out meals with caution to people hospitalized with anorexia does not work.

headline.seo: Hospital Treatment for Anorexia Is Questioned
headline.main: Protocol to Treat Anorexia Is Faulted
headline.print_headline: Protocol To Treat Anorexia Is Faulted
